title: Chapter 268
content:
# Chapter 268

Something watched from the shadows.

Noe.

His small, round haunches shifted left, then right. His paws pressed flat against the stone floor. The best demonic beast of hell stalked his prey.

*This is a scientific, beautiful, and perfectly designed hunting posture.* Noe's tail twitched. *Nyang!*

Crow climbed toward the third-floor landing, unaware. He was a competent assassin, but not skilled enough to sense the best demonic beast of hell lurking in darkness. The third floor housed Isabel's room.

*Soon.*

Crow imagined the moment. His dagger plunging into Grid's flesh.

"Kyong!"

Noe launched himself through the air. His small fangs glinted in the dim light.

Crow's eyes widened. A cat? He'd never been caught off guard by a housecat before.

*I didn't notice it following me?*

The shame burned. The embarrassment stung deeper. But Crow was a professional. He'd survived eighty-nine kills and countless crises. Panic was a luxury he couldn't afford. His breathing steadied. His pulse calmed.

Noe's paw swiped down.

Crow raised his dagger to deflect.

The impact jarred his wrist. His fingers went numb. The blade nearly slipped from his grip.

*Why is this cat so strong?*

Not a normal cat. Crow spotted the details now. Small horns protruding from the forehead. Vestigial wings folded against the back. A high-class demonic beast.

*How is a demonic beast here?*

The Vatican radiated divine power. Monsters couldn't approach without withering. One step past the threshold should have killed this creature.

That was the problem.

Noe struggled to channel his strength. His limbs felt heavy. His reflexes dulled.

*It's serious.*

His master had given clear orders. Stay vigilant while Master concentrated. If enemies invaded, alert Grid immediately. But Noe had failed.

*I moved unconsciously.*

Noe considered himself rational, but instinct ruled him. He was young. When the dark figure slipped through shadows, Noe pounced. No thought. No control. Just action.

The divine power pressed down on him like a weight. The Rebecca Church's Vatican was suffocating. His body refused to obey. But the best demonic beast of hell would never lose to a human.

"Nyaang!"

Noe swung again.

His claws raked across Crow's ear. Blood welled. Crow jerked back, pulse hammering.

*Fast. Too fast for a normal beast.*

The cat was a demonic beast. Clearly. Perhaps it concealed a larger form. Perhaps it possessed the skills of an intermediate-level demonkin. Nothing else explained its presence in the Vatican's sanctified air.

*I need to take this seriously.*

The reason didn't matter. One more target. One more kill.

Crow drew a short sword with his left hand. His right held the dagger. His stance shifted. The famous Crow emerged.

"Kiyong!"

*No strength.*

Crow blocked the next strike with his short sword. He cut diagonally. He thrust with the dagger.

The blade opened a shallow wound on Noe's chest. The short sword sliced through nothing but air. The dagger missed entirely.

Crow's expression twisted.

*It dodged?*

Noe bared his fangs.

"Nyaang!"

The claws came faster. Harder. Crow struggled to parry. He crossed his weapons to block. Then he understood.

*A senior demonkin.*

How was that possible? Demonic beasts served demonkin. They didn't rival them. Shock froze Crow for half a second. Then he reached for his trump card.

The walls trembled. The floor shuddered. The shadows on the ceiling writhed.

Noe's eyes widened.

Crow smiled. "Go to hell."

He spoke for the first time. The shadows on all four sides shifted. They formed thorns.

Six thorns launched from different angles.

Noe recognized the danger. He activated Fluidization.

> [Fluidization]

Physical damage should pass through him harmlessly. But the divine power disrupted the skill. Fluidization failed. Soul Ingestion was completely sealed.

One thorn pierced Noe's small body.

"What, nyang?"

Noe hit the floor. Pain lanced through him.

*It's unfair, nyang.*

Soul Ingestion would have turned the tide. Noe hated the Vatican.

Crow's boot came down on Noe's belly. Noe's mouth gaped. A pained sound escaped. Crow laughed. "This is the end of the demonic beast."

He raised the short sword toward Noe's face.

"Die."

"It's up to here."

Crow spun toward the voice. Nothing. Only darkness filled the space.

*A hallucination?*

No signs. No presence. Stealth beyond human limits.

Then Crow felt it. The shadows slipping from his control.

The shadows surged like a wave. Crow tried to dodge. Too slow.

The force slammed into him. Lifted him. Compressed.

"Kuak!"

Crow's body hurtled through the air. The shadows crushed him.

*The speed. The control. Impossible.*

The shadow technique couldn't evolve to this extent. The pressure increased. Crow thrashed. The pain intensified.

A man stepped from the darkness.

"Y-You...!"

Black skin. Gaunt frame. Arms abnormally long. Only one person fit the description.

"Kasim!" Crow's voice cracked.

The assassin who commanded shadow soldiers. The man who transcended mere offense and defense with shadow arts.

"King of Shadows!"

Why was he here? Crow wanted answers.

Death came instead.

The shadows tightened. Crow couldn't scream. Kasim removed the body. The shadows swept the area clean. Even the bloodstains vanished.

Kasim glanced at the unconscious Noe. "The more I look, the cuter it is."

He disappeared into shadow.

***

Birds chirped. Warm sunlight touched Noe's fur.

"Nya."

Noe woke from peaceful sleep. He looked left. Then right.

"Heok! What is going on? Kyak!"

Dawn. A savage human. A terrible technique. Being knocked unconscious. Noe traced the memories and found them ridiculous. The best demonic beast of hell beaten by a human?

"It's a disgrace! Nyang!"

Unacceptable. Even accounting for the Vatican's suppression. Why should this great body suffer such indignity?

Noe trembled with anger. Then a question surfaced.

"Why am I alive? Nyang?"

If knocked unconscious by a human, death should follow. Noe considered the question. He reached a conclusion.

"It was a dream! Nyang!"

Last night wasn't real.

"Nyahahat! That is it! How can the best demonic beast of hell be beaten by a human? Nyahahat!"

Noe convinced himself.

What other explanation existed? His wounds had healed completely thanks to his tremendous resilience. The logic held.

> Ttiring~

Noe's status shifted from frustration to self-satisfaction.

Grid ignored the pet window. He was too focused on Lifael's Spear.

***

*I'm screwed.*

Grid felt the pressure building. Two days observing Lifael's Spear. No progress. No insight.

*Was I thinking too easily?*

Recent victories had made him complacent.

*I can't understand what's connecting the parts.*

The bonding area was flawless. Grid couldn't identify the technique.

*It's impossible with forging alone. But it isn't one piece.*

Disassembling and reassembling the spear would reveal the secrets. But Isabel made that option impossible. Grid continued observing, building a mental model of the structure.

The next day, an uninvited guest arrived.

Pascal entered the room. "I want to give you a present."

He extended a box. One million gold gleamed inside. Nearly twice Damian's offering of 530,000 gold. In cash terms, 1.2 billion won.

> [Would you like to receive Pascal's gift?]
> [If you receive the gift, you must unconditionally accept one of Pascal's requests.]

Grid snorted. "Are you kidding me? This is the extent of your gift? Get lost."

He wasn't desperate enough to cling to short-term profits anymore. His eyes stayed fixed on the horizon. One million gold wouldn't buy his cooperation in letting the empire devour the Rebecca Church.

Two more days passed.

Grid drove Pascal away. He decided to change his perspective on Lifael's Spear.

*Maybe the secret isn't in the technique but the materials.*

The main ingredient was adamantium. Silver by nature. But the bonding area showed blue.

*No other minerals were used. Something must be mixed with the adamantium.*

There was clearly something else.

*This... perhaps?*

Understanding flickered in Grid's mind.
